info.title: NDEx 2.5.0 REST API
info.description:
This [OpenAPI Specification](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification) document defines the **N**etwork **D**ata **Ex**change (**NDEx**) REST API which is used to communicate with NDEx public and private servers.

This document and all references to the NDEx REST API, source code and ancillary documentation are copyrighted: *Â© 2013-2021, The Regents of the University of California, The Cytoscape Consortium.  All rights reserved.*  Please abide with the [Terms of Use, Licensing and Sources](http://www.home.ndexbio.org/disclaimer-license/). Likewise, the [Swagger-UI](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui) document reader that displays this OpenAPI document is copyrighted by *Smartbear Software*. Its open-source software license is found [here](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui/blob/master/LICENSE).

Google's OAuth2 (OpenID Connect) login is not currently supported.  It will be added when the Swagger-UI document reader permits. Basic Authentication and all other API endpoints are supported.
The full NDEx API specification is found on the [official NDEx API document](http://www.home.ndexbio.org/using-the-ndex-server-api/) webpage.

This OpenAPI project is developed and maintained by [Mike Fidel](mailto:mikefidel.us@gmail.com).  Please submit bug reports, enhancement requests and questions through the project's [GitHub's Issue Tracking](https://github.com/ndexbio/openapi-specification/issues).

servers.description: The host server URL and API version can be overridden.

get.description:
- Get the current operational status of an NDEx server.
- Use this function to check if the NDEx server is running or stopped, as well as list important server properties.
- The `format` query parameter determines what properties are listed by this operation.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Determines the server information to be returned.
  * **standard** - returns properties such as server version and build. The *AdminStatusStandardSchema* Model is returned.
  * **full** - returns standard properties as well as additional properties.  The *AdminStatusFullSchema* Model is returned.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns a JSON array of Group objects.
- The HTTP request payload contains a JSON array of UUIDs which identify which Group objects to fetch.
- No more than 2000 UUIDs are returned.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Creates network export tasks for the set of networks specified by the `networkids` property in the network export request payload.
- The format which to export is specified using the `exportFormat` property in the request payload.
- The /admin/status?format=full function can be used to get a complete list of importers/exporters the server supports."
- Returns a JSON object which maps Network UUIDs to ExportTaskIDs.  The taskId can then be used to download the exported file.  Refer to the *Download Exported File by Task UUID* operation.
- No more than 1000 UUIDs are returned.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns what permissions the authenticated user has on the given list of network UUIDs.
- The response payload is a JSON map in which the keys are network UUIDs and the corresponding values are the highest permission assigned to the authenticated user.
- No more than 500 UUIDs are returned.

items.description: A list of network UUIDs. An example network UUID is entered for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with one or more  network UUIDs, as needed.

schema.description: The keys are network UUIDs and the their values are the highest permission assigned to the authenticated user.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns a JSON array of Network Summary objects.
- The HTTP request payload contains a JSON array of UUIDs which identify which Network Summary objects to fetch.
- This function only returns summaries for public networks if the user is not authenticated, otherwise it returns public and the networks for which the authenticated user has READ permission.
- The optional `accesskey` parameter is supposed to be the accesskey of the network set.  If the given UUIDin the POSTed list is a member of that network set, the server will bypass its permission checking on that network and include the network in the result.
- No more than 2000 UUIDs are returned.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

items.description: A list of network UUIDs. An example network UUID is entered for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with one or more  network UUIDs, as needed.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns a JSON array of User objects.
- The HTTP request payload contains a JSON array of UUIDs which identify which User objects to fetch.
- No more than 2000 UUIDs are returned.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Creates a new group owned by the authenticated user.
- The following properties can be set for the new group
  - `groupName`
  - `image`
  - `website`
  - `description`
- A URL link associated with the newly created group is returned in the response payload upon successful completion.
- The group's UUID is a component of this URL and corresponds to the **groupid** parameter used in subsequent Get/Put/Delete group operations.
- Returns an error if
  - the `groupName` property is not specified or already in use
  - the user is not authenticated

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Retrieves the group specified by **groupid** (i.e. Group UUID).
- Returns an error if the group is not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: The Group object UUID

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates the group metadata associated with the **groupid** path parameter.
- Returns an error if:
  - the group is not found
  - the user is not the owner of the network set

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: The Group object UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

delete.description:
- Deletes the group specified by the **groupid** path parameter.
- Returns an error if:
  - the roup is not found
  - the authenticated user does not have authorization to delete the group

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: The Group object UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Retrieves members of the group associated with the **groupid** path parameter.
- The **type** query parameter can filter which membership types are returned.  All membership types are returned if this query param is omitted.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: The Group object UUID

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index to first object to return.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects to return.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.summary: Add or Update a Group Member
put.description:
- Updates the group membership associated with the **groupid** path parameter.
- An error is returned if:
  - any path or query parameter is omitted
  - the authenticated user does not have Admin permissions for the group
  - the change would leave the group without an Admin member

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: The Group object UUID

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The User object UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

delete.description:
- Removes the group member associated with the **userid** query parameter.
- An error is returned if:
  - the group does not exist
  - the authenticated user is not authorized to edit this group
  - removing the member would leave the group without an Admin member

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: The Group object UUID

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The User object UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
Option 1 - Get Group Permission for a Specific Network
- Using the **networkId=** query parameter:
  - Returns the explicit permission the specified **groupid** has on the specified **networkid**, which is either READ or WRITE.
  - Authentication is manditory to ensure only members of a group can obtain group-network permissions.
---
Option 2 - Get Network Permissions of a Group
- Using **permission=**, **start=** and **size=** query parameters:
  - Returns network permissions for the specified group.
  - The returned JSON object contains key/value pairs,where the key is the network UUID and the value is the corresponding permission.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: (Manditory for Both Options) The Group object UUID

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: (Option 1 only) network UUID to fetch

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: (Option 2 only) 'READ' or 'WRITE' required

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: (Option 2 only) Index to first object to return

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Option 2 only) Number of objects to return

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Creates a CX Network.
- If the POSTed content-type is multipart/form-data, the input CX data is expected to be in the CXNetworkStream field.
- If the POSTed content-type is application/json, the user can post CX data directly in the payload.
- TThe user can use the optional `visibility` parameter ti set the visibility of a network when uploading it.
- Returns an error if
  - the user is not authenticated

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the visibility setting of the network when it is uploaded.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.summary: Get Complete Network in CX Format
get.description:
- Returns the specified network as CX.
- This is performed as a monolithic operation, so it is advisable for applications to first use the **getNetworkSummary** method to check the node and edge counts for a network before retrieving the network.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates the specified network with new content, based on CX data.
- If the POSTed content-type is multipart/form-data, the input CX data is expected to be in the CXNetworkStream field.
- If the POSTed content-type is application/json, the user can post CX data directly in the payload.
- Returns an error if:
  - CX data is not provided
  - the UUID does not correspond to an existing network for which the authenticated user owns or for which they have WRITE permission
  - the CX data is larger than the maximum size of a newwork the current NDEx server allows.
  - the user is not authenticated

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

delete.description:
- Deletes the network specified by networkid.
- There is no method to undo a deletion, so care should be exercised.
- The specified network must be owned by the authenticated user.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Returns an access key to the user.  This access key will allow any user to have read access to this network regardless if that user has READ permissions on this network.
- If the access key is not enabled, a status code of 204 (no payload content) is returned.
- Errors if:
  - The caller is not the owner of this network.
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network
  ---
**Note: The access key function must be enabled in order to return a key.** Refer to *Disable/enable Access Key on Network* operation.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- This operations turns the access key on and off.
- Returns an access key when query parameter `action=enable`.
- Returns a status code of 204 (no payload content) when query parameter `action=disable`.
- Errors if:
  - The caller is not the owner of this network.
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Used to denote whether to disable or enable the access key function.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

get.description:
- Returns the CX metadata collection of the network specified by **networkid**.
- Errors if the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Returns a JSON array of CX elements from the aspect specified by the  **aspectName** path parameter from the network specified by networkid.
- The size parameter is optional, and by default the server will return all elements of this aspect.
- Errors if the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: aspectName
parameters.description: An example aspect name is entered below for demonstration purposes.  It can be replaced with another aspect name, as needed. Examples include 'cartesianCoordinates', 'nodes', 'edges', and 'edgeAttributes'.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects to return.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Returns the CX metadata for the specified aspect of the network specified by **networkid**.
- Errors if the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates aspects of the network specified by **networkid**.
- Put data contains a CX object which includes the specified aspects that will be used to overwrite or insert into the network.
- The networkAttributes aspect should not be updated using this function because it needs
  special handling. Instead, please use the `Update Network Profile` or `Set Network Properties` functions to change values in networkAttributes.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Creates a clone of the network specified by networkid (UUID )into the signed in user's account.
- The URL of the cloned network is returned to the client.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

schema.description: URL of newly created network set.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates the profile information of the network specified by **networkid** based on a POSTed JSON object specifying the attributes to update.
- Any profile attributes specified will be updated, but attributes that are not specified will have no effect - omission of an attribute does not mean deletion of that attribute.
- The network profile attributes that are updated by this method are:
  - `name`
  - `description`
  - `version`

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates the **NetworkAttributes** aspect of the network specified by **networkid** based on the list of **NdexPropertyValuePair** objects in the PUT data.
- Errors if:
  - the authenticated user does not have ADMIN permission to the specified network
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Returns the Provenance aspect of the network specified by **networkid**.
- The returned value is a JSON *ProvenanceEntity* object which in turn contains a tree structure of *ProvenanceEvent* and *ProvenanceEntity* objects that describe the provenance history of the network.
- Refer to the document [NDEx Provenance History](http://www.home.ndexbio.org/network-provenance-history/) for a detailed desciption of this structure and best practices for its use.
- Errors if:
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates the Provenance aspect of the network specified by **networkid** to be the *ProvenanceEntity* object of the PUT data.
- The *ProvenanceEntity* object is intended to represent the current state and history of the network and to contain a tree structure of *ProvenanceEvent* and *ProvenanceEntity* objects that describe the provenance history.
- Refer to the document [NDEx Provenance History](http://www.home.ndexbio.org/network-provenance-history/) for a detailed desciption of this structure and best practices for its use.
- Errors if:
  - the authenticated user does not have ADMIN permission to the specified network
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Returns a sample subnetwork of the network specified by **networkid**.
- The default sample network is created based on an arbitrary selection of 500 edges, created by the NDEx server for networks larger than 500 edges.
- Alternatively, if a sample network has been explicitedly stored using **setNetworkSample** request, that sample network will be returned.
- Returns *ObjectNotFound* exception when:
  - no sample file was found
  - network specified by **networkid** has 500 or fewer edges
  - the sample network is not yet generated by the server at the time of the request.
  - the sample network has been set to null by the network owner.
- Errors if:
  - the authenticated user making the request does not have WRITE or ADMIN permissions to the specified network
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Sets the example network for the network specified by **networkid**.  The sample network is specified by the CX data in the request payload.
- Errors if:
  - the authenticated user does not have ADMIN permissions to the specified network
  - the **networkid** does not correspond to an existing network

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

204.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Retrieves a NetworkSummary JSON object based on the network specified by **networkId**.
- A NetworkSummary object is a subset of a network object.  It is used to convey basic information about a network in this API.
- Error occurs if the network is not found or the authenticated user does not have read permission for the network.
- Anonymous users can only access networks with PUBLIC visibility.

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- The JSON request payload contains key/value pairs that overwrite the corresponding properties of a given network.
- at this time, only the following properties of a network can be updated:
  - `name`
  - `description`
  - `version`
  - `visibility`
  - and `properties`

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Sets the network system properties which describe the network's status in a particular NDEx server.
- These properties are not part of the corresponding CX network object.
- The only supported system properties at this time are:
  - `readOnly`
  - `visibility`
  - `showcase`

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Creates a new network set.
- A URL link associated with the newly created network set is returned in the response payload upon successful completion.
- The network set's UUID is a component of this URL and corresponds to the **networksetid** path parameter used in subsequent Get/Put/Delete network set operations.
- Returns an error when:
  - the `name` property is not specified
  - the user is not authenticated.

schema.description: URL of newly created network set.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

get.description:
- Retrieves the network set specified by the **networksetid** (UUID) path parameter.
- An optional access key query parameter allows any user to have read access to this network set regardless if that user has the READ privilege on this network.
- When the access key query parameter is used:
  - the access key function must be enabled in order to return a key. Refer to *Disable/enable Access Key on Network* operation under the Network tag.
  - a status code of 204 (no content) is returned if the access key function for this network set is not enabled.
- Returns an error when:
  - the access key function for this network set is not enabled
  - the network set does not exist.

parameters.name: networksetid
parameters.description: The network set UUID

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: (Optional) The access key UUID

204.description: ERROR - Access key not enabled for this network set.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Updates the network set specified by the **networksetid** (UUID) path parameter.
- Modifies the specified network set's `name` and `description` properties only.
- Returns an error when:
  - the `name` property is not specified
  - the user is not the owner of the network set
  - the network set does not exist.

parameters.name: networksetid
parameters.description: The network set UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

delete.description:
- Deletes the network set specified by the **networksetid** (UUID) path parameter.
- Returns an error when:
  - the user is not the owner of the nework set
  - the network set does not exist.

parameters.name: networksetid
parameters.description: The network set UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Adds networks to a network set.
- The HTTP request payload holds an array containing one or more **networksetid**'s (UUID's) that denote the networks to add.
- An error is returned if:
  - the network set does not exist
  - the member to add does not exist
  - the user is not the owner of the network set

parameters.name: networksetid
parameters.description: The network set UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

delete.description:
- Deletes one or more networks belonging to a network set.
- The HTTP request payload holds an array containing one or more **networkSetId**'s (UUID's) that denote the networks to delete.
- An error is returned if:
  - the network set does not exist
  - the network member to delete does not exist
  - the user is not the owner of the network set

parameters.name: networksetid
parameters.description: The network set UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

put.description:
- Sets the system properties for the network set specified by **networksetid** (UUID).
- At this time, the only supported system property is `showcase`.
- An error is returned if:
  - the network set does not exist
  - the user is not the owner of the network set

parameters.name: networksetid
parameters.description: The network set UUID

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns a SearchResult object containing an array of Group objects that have text matching
  that being searched for. The total number of Group objects meeting the search criteria is also returned.
- The POSTed request payload object must contain a property key named `searchString` whose value is the text to find.
- Wildcard characters are valid in `searchString`.  All Group objects will be returned when this property's value is an empty string.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index to first object to return.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects to return.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns an array of NetworkSummary objects, and returns the total number of objects found that meet the search criterion.
- The search criterion is found in the request payload's `searchString` property.
- Wildcard characters are valid in `searchString`.
- The search can be constrained using these optional properties:
    - `permission` - filter by READ / WRITE network permission
    - `includeGroups` - filter by user's group permission
    - `accountName` - filter by network owner

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index to first object to return.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects to return.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns an array of Network Summary objects, and returns the total number of objects found that meet the search criterion.
- The `searchString` property contains the search query text. Wildcard characters permitted.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index to first object to return.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects to return.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns a CX Network that is a neighborhood subnetwork where all the paths must start and end at one of the query nodes in the network specified by **networkid**.
- The query finds the subnetwork by a traversal of the network starting with nodes associated with the following properties:
  - `searchString`
  - `searchDepth`
  - `edgeLimit`
  - `errorWhenLimitIsOver`

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: save
parameters.description: Only an authenticated user can call this function with this parameter set to true. When save=true, the server will save the query result as a network in the callerâs account and return the URL of the network resource to the user. Saving query result as a network is a asynchronous call, which means the server will return the URL of the network resource (with HTTP return code 201) while the server is still running the query. User can use the returned UUID to check the status of the network creation process. The default value is false.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

post.description:
- Returns a CX Network that is a neighborhood subnetwork of the network specified by **networkid**.
- The query finds the subnetwork by a traversal of the network starting with nodes associated with the following properties:
  - `searchString`
  - `searchDepth`
  - `edgeLimit`
  - `errorWhenLimitIsOver`
  - `directOnly`

parameters.name: networkid
parameters.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

parameters.name: save
parameters.description: Only an authenticated user can call this function with this parameter set to true. When save=true, the server will save the query result as a network in the callerâs account and return the URL of the network resource to the user. Saving query result as a network is a asynchronous call, which means the server will return the URL of the network resource (with HTTP return code 201) while the server is still running the query. User can use the returned UUID to check the status of the network creation process. The default value is false.

get.description:
- Returns a JSON array of *Task* objects owned by the authenticated user with the specified status.
- The array is ordered by task creation time.
- If the status query parameter is not specified, all tasks owned by this user will be returned.
- An error is returned if:
  - the task does not exist
  - the authenticated user does not own the specified task

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Current state of the task workflow.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index to first object to return.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects to return.

get.description:
Option 1 - Using the **groupId=** query parameter:
- Returns the permission that the user specified by the **userid* path parameter has on that group.
- An empty object is returned if the authenticated user is not a member of the group.
---
Option 2 - Using **type=**, **start=** and **size=** query parameters:
- Returns those groups for which the authenticated user has the specified membership type.
- The **type** query parameter contains the membership types upon which to filter.  If it is omitted, all membership types will be returned.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The User object UUID

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: (Option 1 only) The Group object UUID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: (Option 2 only) Membership type

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: (Option 2 only) Index to first object to return

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Option 2 only) Number of objects to return

schema.description: Object containing key/value pairs representing group UUIDs and their corresponding membership type value of the user.

- Returns a list of *NetworkSummary* objects of which:
  - the user owns
  - the networks are shared with the user directly
- **Userid** path parameter must be an authenticated user's UUID

parameters.description: Number of elements to retrieve in the query.

get.description:
- Returns the permissions assigned to the authenticated user for the specified **networkId**.
- Maps the **networkId** UUID to the highest permission assigned to the authenticated user.
- If the **directonly=** query parameter is set to true, permissions granted through groups are not included in the result. The default value is false.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: The User object UUID

parameters.name: directonly
parameters.description: Grant permissions are to be included in the result.

schema.description: Object containing key/value pairs representing network UUIDs and their respective permission values.

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

500.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

AspectFragmentCxAspectsSchema.description: Contains attributes that describe the state of the network when it was last stored in NDEx. IT IS NOT THE SAME AS THE STATUS ASPECT.

consistencyGroup.description: An integer identifier shared by aspects to indicate that they are mutually consistent.

elementCount.description: number of elements in this aspect

idCounter.description: Required if the aspect exports IDs for its aspect elements. It denotes the highest ID represented in the aspect or any of the aspect's previous versions

items.description: An aspect-defined property list of name-value pairs

networkAttributes.description: List of aspect network attributes objects

edgeAttributes.description: List of aspect edge attribute objects

status.description: A complete CX stream ends with a status aspect object.

CX_NetworkStreamSchema.description: An array containing CX Aspect objects. For details, refer to the [NDEx Network CX Format Data Model](http://www.home.ndexbio.org/data-model/) document.

NetworkSetMembersSchema.description: List of networks belonging to this network set

name.description: - (Required) A short name for the network set.  Names are not unique across all users, but they should be unique within a user.

description.description: - (Optional) An abstract or summary about this network set.

example.name: Name of this network set
example.description: A summary of what this network set is about.

resultList.description: List of returned group objects matching search criteria.

numFound.description: Number of Group objects matching search criteria.

start.description: Index to first object returned relative to numFound.

resultList.description: List of returned User objects matching search criteria.

numFound.description: Number of User objects matching search criteria.

start.description: Index to first object returned relative to numFound.

searchString.description: Text used for the search. It can include wildcards.

SearchStringRequestPayloadSchema.description: A POSTed request payload specifying the text string to search for.

taskOwnerId.description: uuid of the user who owns this task

resource.description: uuid of the network associated with this task

externalId.description: the uuid of this task object

exportFormat.description: The format is not limited to CX network formats; it can potentially include other formats derived from the stored network such as gene lists in GSEA format.

items.description: A list of network UUIDs. An example network UUID is entered for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with one or more  network UUIDs, as needed.

showcase.description: - (Required) Controls the visibility of the network set on the owner's homepage.

permission.description:
- (Optional) Use if there is to be filtering based on permission. When provided, it must be specified as either *READ* or *WRITE* only.
- **WRITE** - the search will only return networks for which the authenticated user has **edit** or **admin** permission.
- **READ** - the search will only return networks for which the authenticated user has edit, admin, or read permission.  Note that this only includes networks that are readable to explicit permission, and NOT networks that are readable because they have been made public.

includeGroups.description:
- (Optional) Defaults to false.
- If set to true, the search will also return networks based on permissions from the authenticated user's group memberships.
- This enables the search to return a network where a group has permission to access the network and the user is a member of the group.

accountName.description: - (Optional) If provided, the search will be constrained to networks owned by the specified account.

numFound.description: number of NetworkSummary objects meeting search criterion

start.description: index to first NetworkSummary object returned relative to numFound

numFound.description: number of NetworkSummary objects meeting search criterion

start.description: index to first NetworkSummary object relative to numFound

searchString.description:
- (Required) A whitespace delimited string of search terms which are matched against
  1. the controlled vocabulary terms used in the network
  2. node names in the network
- A set of initial nodes is selected based on association with matched terms or simple name match.
- The query selects edges based on traversal from those initial nodes.

searchDepth.description:
- An integer value between 1 and 2.  It sets the maximum number of traversal steps from the initial nodes.
- If the search depth is less than 1, the server will do a 1-step search.
default: 1

edgeLimit.description:
- (Optional) Sets the maximum number of edges that this query can return.
  A negative or zero value means no limit in the query.

errorWhenLimitIsOver.description:
- (Optional) If this value is true the server stops streaming the network when it hits the edgeLimit, and add success: false and
  error: "EdgeLimitExceeded" in the status aspect and close the CX stream.
- If this value is false, the server returns a subnetwork with edge count up to edgeLimit. The status aspect will be a success, and a network attribute "EdgeLimitExceeded": "true" will be added to the returned network only if the server hits the edgeLimit.

body_9.description: The example values used are for demonstration purposes. They can be replaced, as needed.

searchString.description:
- (Required) A whitespace delimited string of search terms which are matched against
  1. the controlled vocabulary terms used in the network
  2. node names in the network
- A set of initial nodes is selected based on association with matched terms or simple name match.
- The query selects edges based on traversal from those initial nodes.

searchDepth.description:
- (Optional) Sets the maximum number of traversal steps from the initial node.
- If the search depth is less than 1, the server will do a 1-step search.

edgeLimit.description:
- (Optional) Sets the maximum number of edges that this query can return.
  A negative or zero value means no limit in the query.

errorWhenLimitIsOver.description:
- (Optional) If this value is true the server stops streaming the network when it hits the edgeLimit, and add success: false and
  error: "EdgeLimitExceeded" in the status aspect and close the CX stream.
- If this value is set to false, the server returns a subnetwork with edge count up to edgeLimit. The status aspect will be a success, and a network attribute "EdgeLimitExceeded": "true" will be added to the returned network only if the server hits the edgeLimit.

directOnly.description:
- (Optional) If this value is false a full neighborhood will be returned.
- If this value is set to true, the edges between the n-th step neighbor vertex will be excluded from the result.

body_10.description: The example values used are for demonstration purposes. They can be replaced, as needed.

error.description: Holds the error message if an error occured when generating the CX document.

success.description: Set to true if the CX document is successfully generated by the source.

401-response.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Check that you are authenticated (i.e. Signed In) and have the  credentials to access that NDEx object.

404-response.description: NOT FOUND: The object that was requested does not exist.

500-response.description: ERROR: Catch-all bucket for http status codes that denote an error occurred. Check for malformed or incorrect parameters or request payloads.

AccessKeyParam.name: action
AccessKeyParam.description: Used to denote whether to disable or enable the access key function.

AdminStatusParam.name: format
AdminStatusParam.description:
Determines the server information to be returned.
  * **standard** - returns properties such as server version and build. The *AdminStatusStandardSchema* Model is returned.
  * **full** - returns standard properties as well as additional properties.  The *AdminStatusFullSchema* Model is returned.

AspectNameDemoPath.name: aspectName
AspectNameDemoPath.description: An example aspect name is entered below for demonstration purposes.  It can be replaced with another aspect name, as needed. Examples include 'cartesianCoordinates', 'nodes', 'edges', and 'edgeAttributes'.

BlockSizePath.name: blockSize
BlockSizePath.description: Maximum number of blocks to retrieve in the query.

DirectOnlyParam.name: directonly
DirectOnlyParam.description: Grant permissions are to be included in the result.

LimitParam.name: limit
LimitParam.description: Number of elements to retrieve in the query.

NetworkIdPath.name: networkid
NetworkIdPath.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network element when it is created.

NetworkIdDemoPath.name: networkid
NetworkIdDemoPath.description: A unique identifier (UUID) given to the network acted upon, in the form xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx. An example network UUID is entered below for demonstration purposes. It can be replaced with another network UUID, as needed.

OffsetParam.name: offset
OffsetParam.description: Index to first object to return.

SaveParam.name: save
SaveParam.description: Only an authenticated user can call this function with this parameter set to true. When save=true, the server will save the query result as a network in the callerâs account and return the URL of the network resource to the user. Saving query result as a network is a asynchronous call, which means the server will return the URL of the network resource (with HTTP return code 201) while the server is still running the query. User can use the returned UUID to check the status of the network creation process. The default value is false.

StartParam.name: start
StartParam.description: Index to first object to return.

ShowcaseParam.name: showcase
ShowcaseParam.description: When true, only showcased networksets are returned

SummaryParam.name: summary
SummaryParam.description: When true, the server will not return the list of network IDs in this network set

TaskStatusParam.name: status
TaskStatusParam.description: Current state of the task workflow.

VisibilityParam.name: visibility
VisibilityParam.description: (Optional) Indicates the visibility setting of the network when it is uploaded.
